result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Douglas J Allen
Current: PO Box 92, Rib Lake, WI 54470-0092 United States  (Effective: 03-05-2015)
Prior: 215A Jordan Road, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

Defendant Douglas J Allen in court with attorney Anne Renc. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 12CF464, 13CF441, 13CT116, 13CT411, 14CF11, 14CT33, 14TR95
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Parties makes statements regarding the federal gun laws.  
Court questions defendant re: Federal laws vs. State laws.  Cannot prohibit the defendant for not having firearms while actively engaged in military service.  This Court cannot order that he have firearms if the Federal Law prohibits it. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea to the following: 
12CF464 - Counts 2 & 3 NO CONTEST
13CT116 - NO CONTEST
13CT411 - NO CONTEST
14CF11 Count 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
12CF464 Counts 2 & 3
13CT116
13CT411
14CF11

Dismissed and Read-in:
12CF464 Count 1
14CF11 Counts 1, 2 & 4
14CT33
14TR95
13CF441

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
12CF464 Counts 2 & 3
Sentence Withheld. Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Successfully attend and complete DAAP.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent. 
In addition to DAAP, attend Anger Management if recommended by the agent. 
No abusive contact with Tonya Allen. 
Court does not prohibit him from possessing firearms while he is serving his country in military service and during the course of his military service.
Comply with federal law. 
Pay costs including domestic abuse surcharge on each of the counts. 

14CF11
Sentence withheld. Placed on probation for a period of 24 months concurrent with 12CF464:
Same conditions as 12CF464.
Pay costs. 

13CT116
30 days in jail.
Allowed to serve full 30 days on home monitor program, if approved by jail. 
Huber for employment and counseling
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
6 months revocation of license
Pay costs.

13CT411
30 days in jail, consecutive to 13CT116.
Allowed to serve full 30 days on home monitor program, if approved by jail. 
Huber for employment and counseling. 
Pay costs. 
6 months revocation of license, concurrent to 13CT116.

Costs on all files to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Any bonds posted in any of the files to be applied to the fines and costs.
Plea hearing on February 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas J Allen in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 13CF441 and 14CF11 are being heard for arraignments today.
  Arraignments:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
ADA Knaapen states that 02-21-14 at 1:30 was scheduled for motion hearing, but request it be used as a plea & sentencing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
In both files: 14CF11 and 13CF441: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

BY THE COURT: Bond is continued on all files.

Defendant Douglas J Allen in court with attorney Anne Renc. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed in 14CF11.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
